docs.text: you always have to be careful with the first official studio release out of the gate each year .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they're obviously films for which the studios have no great hopes ( having missed both the deadline for academy award eligibility and the big box-office holiday season ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: combine that with howie long's first starring action role , and you've got a doozy of a movie that , while not as bad as it could have been , isn't a very good film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: howie stars as an ace smokejumper ( a firefighter who parachutes into forest fires unreachable from the ground ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the slightly contrived opening scenes , we witness his heroism in action , as he , and his mentor ( played by scott glenn ) attempt to rescue a small girl and her dog from an oncoming forest fire .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: william forsythe plays the bad guy , a mass murderer who has several million dollars tucked away to help fund his jailbreak .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he ( and five convict cohorts ) manages to get selected for firefighting duty when a woodland blaze just happens to ignite nearby .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his escape plan bets a lot on the laxity of the guards , but ( since there must be a movie ) luck is with him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: soon the now-escaped convicts are masquerading as canadian firefighters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why canadian ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: who knows , eh ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way they pick up a pretty birdwatcher ( suzy amis ) to be their hostage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: enter howie long .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he's called in to help fight the blaze , and when he spots the group of " ground pounders " , apparently lost , he parachutes in to help .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when he discovers their true identity , he is the only thing standing between them and escape , and the only hope of help for the hostage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: long's acting talents are above those of , say , steven seagal , but not by much .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although his delivery is mostly flat and wooden , he's a likeable hero , and there are some hints here and there that he may get better .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script doesn't help him out any , however .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all too often , it veers into the realm of the unintentionally funny .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the dialogue is strictly b-movie material , and the plotting relies too heavily on coincidences to be believable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: long's co-stars are a mixed bag .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at least they're all comfortable in their respective roles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: forsythe has the scenery-chewing villain down cold , down cold , and scott glenn is always enjoyable to watch , even when he doesn't seem to be stretching his talents ( as is definitely the case here ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: suzy amis plays peril pretty well , but isn't given much more to do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the nature and wildfire shots are interesting , but many are rather bland .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you'd think that the director , dean semler , a former cinematographer , would at least produce a film with interesting visuals .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's not the case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a lack of originality to nearly all the sequences . . . we've
docs.label: negative

docs.text: seen this stuff before .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's not the most auspicious start to 1998 , but it could have been worse ( just think back to 1996's debut , bio-dome ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , after a month of oscar-caliber pictures , a movie like firestorm at least gives you some perspective on how good those movies really were .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in fact , there's a good chance that some of them are still playing near you . . .
docs.label: negative
